children.subject:
I asked and they said it will count.

I was concerned because I heard negative reviews about 169.

Thank you!

Make sure to double check that you can still use 169A since its different than normal 169, namely that it is 3 units. That being said, for that same reason I'd probably take it if I were you since it seems like it would be a bit easier and perhaps will give you a broader SWE experience. But again make sure the unit difference isn't an issue.

On the other hand, I'm in 161 right now and they are doing a pretty good job with the online situation. The class is really interesting despite how specific it is, and the projects are fun so that is also something to consider. Workload is pretty medium-lighter as far as other CS courses go

history.content:
Background:

I'm a rising senior looking to go into public health related field after graduation.

I need a CS class to finish my CS minor requirement.

I will be taking one of these classes along with research over summer.

Question:

-Which one of these classes will be better for me considering that I don't intend on going into tech industry?

-I thought 161 would be too specific and is geared towards students looking to be developers. But I've heard very good things about this class and posts on this piazza make it look like this class is very important regardless of career paths.

-But because I don't have any internship experience is SWE, I thought I will be able to use what I learned so far by doing a minor if I take 169, since I don't feel like I can use what I learned and make any practical software.

-If I plan on utilizing what I learned through CS minor and continue to develop and participate in events like hackathons, which of these classes will be better? I also need a higher grade over this summer to maintain/improve my gpa.

Thank you for your help; any thoughts or comments would be appreciated!
history.subject: advice needed: 161 vs w169a summer
